Name: Shabti of the lady Meryt
Description: This limestone funerary statuette is exceptional from several points of view. Measuring 35 cm, it represents the mummy of a woman. The hands, sticking out of the shroud, hold two farming instruments: in the left hand, the hoe, in the right hand, a small sack of grain. The piece bears a hieroglyphic inscription mentioning the name of the owner - the lady Meryt - and contains Chapter 6 of the Book of the Dead, followed by a rare formula which describes the exact role of the shabti in the Afterlife.
